Where should you go in Spain in december when it comes to the weather?

Remember:

The climate in Spain in december ranges from good to very bad depending on the region and city.

Winter is already present, as the climate throughout December in Spain is under an oceanic and Mediterranean influence - freshness and gentleness replace the harsh climatic conditions of the previous months, except for the localities located towards the interior.

Barcelona and Catalonia in December

The days are cold, with very low morning temperatures and milder days. On the other hand, in Barcelona, the climatic conditions are less severe.

Madrid and Castile in December

As in Catalonia, the weather in Spain throughout December is characterized by the cold. Even if the sun is still present, the wearing of warm clothes is of great importance in order to feel comfortable.

Galicia, Asturias and Cantabria in December

The cool and abundant rains make the climate in Bilbao and Gijón unfavorable. On the other hand, that of Santiago de Compostela is hardly acceptable because of the rain and the fog.

Andalusia and Valencia in December

Only the localities of Malaga and Tarifa will benefit from climatic conditions that are still favorable to the practice of tourist activities.

Climate in Madrid in december

In the month of december, maximum temperature is 12°C and minimum temperature is 5°C (for an average temperature of 9°C). The climate is fairly fresh in this city in december, but it is tolerable when dressing hot. With 54mm over 3 days, you risk getting wet slightly during your trip. But this is moderate and it is only of temporary showers.

With an unfavorable weather, the month of december is not the best time to go in this city.

Weather data for Spain in december:

Weather data for Spain in december is derived from an average of the weather forecast since 2009 in Spain. There is a margin of error and these forecasts are to be considered as general information only. The weather in Spain can vary slightly from year to year, but these predictions should limit surprises. So you can pack your bags and check when is the best time to go to Spain.
